question_sentence: How many alleged gang members have been jailed in El Salvador since a major crackdown on crime began in March last year?
evidence: President Nayib Bukele’s government has locked up a total of almost 2% of the country's adult population and has built a 40,000-capacity mega prison to accommodate suspected gang members.

question_sentence: The UK’s so-called “wonkiest pub” has closed after almost 200 years of trading in which county?
evidence: The historic Crooked House, in the village of Himley, has called time following 192 years of trading, after being sold to a private buyer “for alternative use”.

question_sentence: Which country is set to become the 29th African nation to abolish the death penalty?
evidence: The West African country’s parliament has voted to abolish the death penalty, offering an expected reprieve for 176 condemned prisoners. If President Nana Akufo-Addo assents to the new law, Ghana will become the 124th nation in the world to outlaw the penalty.

question_sentence: Disney this week stopped selling what in Australia?
evidence: Disney has ceased releasing its films or TV shows on physical media formats in Australia, following a steep decline in sales of DVDs, Blu-rays and the like as streaming services become increasingly popular.

question_sentence: The public have regained the right to “wild camp” in which English national park?
evidence: The National Park Authority this week won an appeal against a High Court ruling in January that visitors did not have the right to camp on Dartmoor without the landowners’ permission. The national park in Devon is the only place in England and Wales where wild camping is legal, under a decades-old local law.

question_sentence: Which England football player scored twice in Tuesday’s 6-1 win against China at the Women’s World Cup?
evidence: The Lionesses secured a place in the last 16 of the tournament, taking place in Australia and New Zealand, with goals by Chelsea forward James, Alessia Russo, Lauren Hemp, Chloe Kelly and Rachel Daly.

question_sentence: Scientists have revived what animal that was frozen 46,000 years ago?
evidence: The microscopic roundworm, or nematode, had lain dormant in Siberian permafrost since the last Ice Age. It was unearthed from a fossilised squirrel burrow extracted from the northeastern Arctic in 2002.

question_sentence: Recent shows in Seattle by which music star generated seismic activity equivalent to a 2.3 magnitude earthquake?
Birch trees are being blamed for a doubling of what in England over the past 20 years?
evidence: According to experts, an increase in the number of birch trees being planted, plus the wider availability of foods from around the world, has fuelled hospital admissions for allergies and anaphylaxis, which have increased from 12,361 in 2002-03 to 25,721 in the past year. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Which world leader announced this week that he and his wife of 18 years were splitting up?
evidence: In an announcement on Instagram, the Canadian prime minister and his wife, former TV presenter Sophie Grégoire Trudeau, said they had decided to separate following “many meaningful and difficult conversations”. They were married in Montreal in 2005 and have three children together.

question_sentence: Amazon is growing its footprint in the health sector. Which service did the e-commerce giant launch nationwide this week?
evidence: Amazon’s virtual clinic is now offering telehealth appointments in all 50 states and Washington, DC, the company announced on Tuesday. Amazon previously launched its own digital drugstore, Amazon Pharmacy, in 2020.

question_sentence: Former President Donald Trump was indicted this week for his alleged efforts to remain in the White House following his 2020 election loss. How many times has Trump been indicted?
evidence: Trump was handed down a third indictment this week, and political analysts say this one may be the most consequential. He was previously indicted for his involvement in a hush-money scheme before he became president and for the alleged mishandling of classified material after he left office.

question_sentence: Which typhoon recently soaked Beijing with the city’s heaviest rainfall in 140 years?
evidence: Typhoon Doksuri dumped an entire month’s worth of rainfall on Beijing in only 48 hours, sparking rescue missions for survivors trapped by flooded streets.

question_sentence: Which soccer team was shockingly knocked out of the Women’s World Cup this week?
evidence: Germany, the two-time champion team, was dramatically knocked out of the World Cup on Thursday after a 1-1 draw with South Korea.

question_sentence: Which type of lunar phenomenon lit up the night sky this week?
evidence: A sturgeon supermoon created a magnificent sight across the world this week. This luminous spectacle occurs when the moon nears its closest point to Earth while appearing full.

question_sentence: Which automaker recalled more than 870,000 trucks because the parking brake could engage unexpectedly?
evidence: Ford recalled hundreds of thousands of F-150 trucks this week due to a parking brake issue. So far, the automaker is aware of 299 instances of the parking brake activating unintentionally, including at least 19 while the vehicle was being driven.

question_sentence: One of the longest hot weather streaks in US history finally ended this week. Which city saw temperatures over 110 degrees for 31 consecutive days?
evidence: Phoenix just endured the hottest month for any US city on record. Temperatures in the region peaked under 110 degrees Fahrenheit for the first time in a month on Monday.

question_sentence: Health officials anticipate a new Covid-19 vaccine will be released in the US by which month?
evidence: The new Covid-19 vaccines, which should be ready by the end of September, will be made available directly from the manufacturers on the commercial market, rather than through the US government.

question_sentence: Which world leader announced he and his spouse have agreed to separate after 18 years of marriage?
evidence: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced Wednesday that he and his wife Sophie Grégoire Trudeau are separating. The Trudeaus have three children together, all under the age of 15.

question_sentence: Which musician is being praised for giving “life-changing” bonuses to her truck drivers?
evidence: Taylor Swift stunned her concert tour’s trucking staff by giving each trucker a check in the amount of $100,000. “The typical amount is $5,000 to $10,000 each. So this large amount is unbelievable,” said Michael Scherkenbach, founder and CEO of Shomotion trucking company, which handles transportation of the stage and structure for Swift’s Eras Tour.
